definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

sentences.english: The bell is on the bedside.
The bell is within my reach.
He begs me helps to seek electric bell front door circuit.
sentences.chinese: 他請求我幫助設計一個電鈴門電路。

sentences.english: He awoke to the ringing of an electric bell.
sentences.chinese: 他隨著一陣電鈴的響聲醒來。

sentences.english: If you need help, please push the bell—button.
sentences.chinese: 您有事情喚服務員，請按電鈴。

sentences.english: He touched the bell and a servant appeared.
sentences.chinese: 他按一下電鈴，僕人就來了。

sentences.english: If The Bell Dosn't Work, Class Released on The Teacher's Order.
sentences.chinese: 電鈴未正常工作時，以教師的指令爲準。

sentences.english: Bell signal systems and communication systems must be using at same time for decline hoisting system.
sentences.chinese: 斜井提升應同時設立電鈴和電話兩套信號系統。

sentences.english: Yes, there is an electric bell.
If you want an attendant, Please push the bell.
sentences.chinese: 您有事喚服務員，請按電鈴。

sentences.english: And groping with one hand , she pressed the knob of an electric bell by her beds head.
sentences.chinese: 隨後，她用一隻手摸索着，撳了一下牀頭的電鈴。

definition: to return something to its rightful owner
to whisper to one another's ear
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
lit. firing after the horse/fig. belated action/giving advice in hindsight
